page.title: 07Transport through Cliffe
page.content: There used to be three{railways} through the area of Cliffe. On the common was the junction between the Selby to Market Weighton Railway and the Derwent Valley Light Railway, but both of these have closed. Trains from Hull to Selby, Leeds and York go through Cliffe, but none stop at the station in Cliffe, which was called Hemingbrough Station, because when the line was built in 1840 Cliffe was in that parish. The Selby to Hemingbrough{bus} {service}goes through Cliffe and Osgodby, 12 buses in each direction each day. The fare from Cliffe to Selby is 65p, and three people can travel by taxi for less than the bus fare. Anybody who works further away than Selby has to have their own transport. South Duffield has no public transport.
